results.headline: Review: ‘Lost and Love’ (‘Shi Gu’) Stars Andy Lau as a Man Searching for His Lost Son
results.summary_short: Peng Sanyuan’s drama builds a personal story and a road movie around the scourge of child trafficking in China.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lost and Love

results.headline: Review: In ‘Zombeavers,’ the Flesheaters Have Overbites
results.summary_short: The undead chompers are bucktoothed in the cheesy, gory “Zombeavers,” directed by Jordan Rubin.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Zombeavers

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tracers,’ Taylor Lautner Joins a Shady Parkour Gang
results.summary_short: Part urban crime film, part romantic fantasy, Daniel Benmayor’s film shows love not just for stunts but for the dynamic surfaces of the city.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tracers

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Gunman,’ Sean Penn Plays a Remorseful Sniper on the Run
results.summary_short: This globe-trotting action thriller is also, in passing, a melodrama of male sexual jealousy, an indictment of Western meddling in Africa and a concussion-awareness public service announcement.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Gunman

results.headline: Review: ‘Insurgent’ Brandishes a Tougher Shailene Woodley
results.summary_short: In the second of the “Divergent” series of dystopic action films, Tris Prior, the lead character, is a more comfortable lock-and-load renegade.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Divergent Series: Insurgent

results.headline: Review: In ‘Spring,’ Romance Gives Way to a Beastly Horror
results.summary_short: The film, by Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead, depicts a young American who goes to Italy to find himself and instead finds much more than he bargained for.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Spring

results.headline: Review: In ‘She’s Lost Control,’ Crossing Boundaries in Pursuit of Intimacy
results.summary_short: Anja Marquardt’s film is a chilly and bleak portrait of a behavioral psychologist who works as a sexual surrogate and takes on a client with serious intimacy issues.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of She's Lost Control

results.headline: Review: In Eugène Green’s ‘La Sapienza,’ a Search of Ideals of Civilization
results.summary_short: Though set in the present, “La Sapienza,” which takes its name from a venerable university in Rome, finds inspiration and sustenance in the past.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of La Sapienza

results.headline: Review: ‘Growing Up and Other Lies’ Stares Down the Advent of Adulthood
results.summary_short: The film centers on a group of men who walk the length of Manhattan in a vain attempt to recapture the euphoria of their early 20s.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Growing Up & Other Lies

results.headline: Review: ‘Can’t Stand Losing You,’ Andy Summers’s Version of the Police
results.summary_short: Neither Sting nor Stewart Copeland contributes to this documentary based on a memoir by the band’s guitarist, Mr. Summers.
results.display_title: Can't Stand Losing You: Surviving the Police

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Can't Stand Losing You: Surviving the Police

results.headline: Review: ‘Backcountry,’ a Wilderness Survival Thriller
results.summary_short: “Backcountry” unfolds in a dense forest where two hapless hikers meet with all manner of terrors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Backcountry

results.headline: Review: Al Pacino in ‘Danny Collins’ Plays a Dissolute Pop Star
results.summary_short: In Dan Fogelman’s comic drama, a 40-year-old letter from John Lennon could change a jaded older singer’s life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Danny Collins

results.headline: Review: ‘Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter,’ Inspired by an Urban Legend
results.summary_short: A Japanese woman gets the disastrously incorrect idea that the Coen brothers’ movie “Fargo” depicts a true story in this movie by two other siblings, David and Nathan Zellner.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter

results.headline: Review: ‘Amour Fou,’ About the Woman in a Poet’s Suicide Pact
results.summary_short: Jessica Hausner’s drama about a 19th-century German suicide pact is based on the angst and death of the poet and playwright Heinrich von Kleist.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Amour fou

results.headline: Review: ‘Seymour: An Introduction’ Is a Lesson in Perseverance
results.summary_short: This film directed by Ethan Hawke is a big-hearted documentary of a pianist, composer, teacher, philosopher and ultimate New Yorker.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Seymour: An Introduction

results.headline: Review: ‘Like Sunday, Like Rain,’ a Sentimental Intersection of Two Lives
results.summary_short: In Frank Whaley’s film, a young New Yorker (Leighton Meester) ends up as an unlikely companion to a 13-year-old prodigy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Like Sunday, Like Rain

results.headline: Review: In ‘It Follows,’ a Shape-Shifting Horror Stalks a Teenager
results.summary_short: David Robert Mitchell’s second feature film is set in a Detroit suburb, where a deadly menace is passed from one person to another through sex.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of It Follows

results.headline: Review: In ‘Eva,’ Robot Designer Loves Cute Kid
results.summary_short: In Kike Maíllo’s Spanish drama, a prodigy returns to his hometown to work on programming an android with the emotional life of a real child.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eva

results.headline: Review: ‘Walter’ Is Obsessed With Fate
results.summary_short: An obsessive-compulsive in his early 20s believes himself to be a son of God, required to decide the final destination — heaven or hell — of every individual he sees.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Walter

results.headline: Review: ‘The Wrecking Crew’ Hails the Music Behind the Faces
results.summary_short: This sentimental documentary revolves around a cabal of versatile Los Angeles session musicians fluent in rock, soul, country and getting out of the way.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wrecking Crew
